page.title: 10Eskdaleside Manor; a poem.
page.content: {ESKDALEGATE South-West of Sleights there lies a road Where once the Lords of Manor rode With greatest dignity and Pride, To Manor House of Eskdaleside. Built up in sixteen ninty seven The house rose up like bread and leaven, Three storeys built with great dispatch, Were covered skilfully with thatch For tiles were not yet on their way Though later they had come to stay. The Lord's Apartments,on the East, Were quite cut off from man and beast, While on the other side,the farm, Was noisy,thrang,and never calm. BUT FARMS WERE REALLY BUILT FOR STOCK WHILE MANORS WERE FOR ARISTOC! { } { BY SLEIGHTS AUTHOR BRENDA H.ENGLISH
